00008 /*
00009  * Disclaimer: I am clueless how to use boost::gregorian in a sensible way.
00010  *
00011  * That, together with the fact that I wanted to test WRegExpValiator
00012  * is the reason why I use a regular expression to get the
00013  * day/month/year fields, and boost::gregorian to check that the date
00014  * is a valid date.
00015  */
00016 
00017 DateValidator::DateValidator(const date& bottom, const date& top)
00018   : WRegExpValidator(L"(\\d{1,2})/(\\d{1,2})/(\\d{4})"),
00019     bottom_(bottom),
00020     top_(top)
00021 { }
00022 
00023 WValidator::State DateValidator::validate(std::wstring& input, int& pos) const
00024 {
00025   WValidator::State state = WRegExpValidator::validate(input, pos);
00026 
00027   if ((state == Valid) && !input.empty()) {
00028     boost::wsmatch what;
00029     boost::regex_match(input, what, regExp());
00030 
00031     try {
00032       date d
00033         = from_string(Wt::narrow(what[3] + L"/" + what[2] + L"/" + what[1]));
00034 
00035       if ((d >= bottom_) && (d <= top_))
00036         return Valid;
00037       else
00038         return Invalid;
00039 
00040     } catch (std::exception& e) {
00041       return Invalid;
00042     }
00043   } else
00044     return state;
00045 }
